structuralFindings.rationale: Based on existing specimen classification. New observations from earnings/research session.

quotes.text: We are not graded on effort. We are judged on our results.
quotes.speaker: Jane Fraser
quotes.context: Internal memo to staff coinciding with Q4 earnings and ~1,000 additional cuts

quotes.text: The last vestiges of old, bad habits
quotes.speaker: Jane Fraser
quotes.context: Describing what must be eliminated as part of restructuring — framing AI adoption as inseparable from cultural transformation

sources.name: 20K headcount reduction target with 10K+ already cut
sources.notes: 20K headcount reduction target with 10K+ already cut

sources.name: $2.5B annualized cost savings target from AI and automation
sources.notes: $2.5B annualized cost savings target from AI and automation

summary: 20K headcount reduction target with 10K+ already cut: Under 'Project Bora Bora' restructuring unveiled early 2024, Citi targets up to 20,000 role eliminations (~8% of global workforce) by 2026 to simplify management layers and streamline businesses. Over $2.5B annualized cost savings target from AI and automation: AI initiatives on track to deliver up to $2.5 billion in annualized cost savings. Specific metrics: 9% increase in software developer productivity, 2.6 million customer interactions automated per mont 70% AI adoption across 84 countries, 21M+ tool interactions: Colleagues in 84 countries have interacted with Citi's proprietary AI tools more than 21 million times. AI adoption rate now above 70%. Fraser confirmed 175K employees completed mandatory AI training  Fraser frames AI restructuring as cultural transformation: Fraser used Q4 earnings to declare 'the last vestiges of old, bad habits' must disappear, demanding a 'more commercial mindset.' She stated 'We are not graded on effort. We are judged on our results.'
